Name: Talamanca Range-La Amistad Reserves / La Amistad National Park
Description: Talamanca Range-La Amistad Reserves / La Amistad National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Transboundary protected area shared with Panama, containing one of the most important remaining areas of tropical forest in Central America with exceptional biodiversity.

Name: Cocos Island National Park
Description: Cocos Island National Park - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Remote island in the Pacific Ocean known for its exceptional marine biodiversity, including large populations of sharks, rays, and other pelagic species.

Name: Area de Conservación Guanacaste
Description: Area de Conservación Guanacaste - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Large protected area containing important dry forest, cloud forest, and marine ecosystems with exceptional biodiversity and numerous endemic species.

Name: Precolumbian Chiefdom Settlements with Stone Spheres of the Diquís
Description: Precolumbian Chiefdom Settlements with Stone Spheres of the Diquís - UNESCO World Heritage Site. Archaeological sites containing mysterious stone spheres and remains of pre-Columbian chiefdom settlements dating from AD 500-1500.
